title: ho ho ho
content: does anyone know where i can procure a typographically brilliant christmas card? hook me up with the link! promote your own work. (as long as it's brilliant. hee hee.)
author: sohappy2

comments.content: not to hijack this thread completely, but does anyone know of any print-on-demand places that do cards? (i guess i could check cafe press myself, eh?)
I do mine on my Epson SPR300: depending on quantity (i.e., under 50), it's as cheap if not cheaper than most POD places.

House - cards and wrap - [http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=stationery](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805095107/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=stationery "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=stationery")

Emigre - wrap - [http://www.emigre.com/Wrap.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805095107/http:/www.emigre.com/Wrap.php "http://www.emigre.com/Wrap.php")
If you are so happy to be near a shop that sells Hallmark cards you could check them out.

I think the _Dot Screen Holiday_ cards from [Plum Press](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805095107/http:/www.plumpress.com/) are adorable.

FWIW: [Sara Soskolne](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805095107/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Sara%20Soskolne), who works at Hoefler & Frere-Jones, is one of the partners.

Crane has nice cards, but they're somewhat pricey.

[http://www.crane.com/navSubDepartment.aspx?NavName=NavShop&DeptName=Holi...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805095107/http:/www.crane.com/navSubDepartment.aspx?NavName=NavShop&DeptName=Holiday&Name=CranesBoxedHolidayCards "http://www.crane.com/navSubDepartment.aspx?NavName=NavShop&DeptName=Holiday&Name=CranesBoxedHolidayCards")
